text: Act to amend the Act of 2nd June, 1939, relating to holidays with pay for seamen22 [the amendments provide (1) that ratings shall be entitled to twelve days' holiday after one year's service (instead of nine days as previously), (2) that all seamen shall be entitled to compensation for six working days if they leave the employment after service for not less than six months but less than one year; and (3) that in the case of vessels engaged in seasonal trade compensation shall be paid (after three months' service) at the rate of one working day for every complete month's service]. (S.A. or F.F. No. 273)
full_text: Apr. 27 Act to amend the Act of 2nd June, 1939, relating to holidays with pay for seamen22 [the amendments provide (1) that ratings shall be entitled to twelve days' holiday after one year's service (instead of nine days as previously), (2) that all seamen shall be entitled to compensation for six working days if they leave the employment after service for not less than six months but less than one year; and (3) that in the case of vessels engaged in seasonal trade compensation shall be paid (after three months' service) at the rate of one working day for every complete month's service]. (S.A. or F.F. No. 273)
